intro: Borreria simplex, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically violet or blue in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Borreria simplex is also used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
